definition: silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: Velour provides extra softness and size.
sentences.chinese: 丝绒质地更加柔软，尺寸也更大。

sentences.english: His voice is wistful , as soft as velvet .
sentences.chinese: 他的惆怅的声音如丝绒般温柔。

sentences.english: Stars were twinkling in the back velvet of the night.
sentences.chinese: 星星在黑丝绒一般的夜空里闪烁。

sentences.english: The jungle spread beneath him in a green velvet nap .
sentences.chinese: 丛林铺展在他的脚下，象一片绿丝绒那么毛茸茸的。

sentences.english: In China, velour making dates back to two thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 丝绒生产在我国已有两千年的历史。

sentences.english: The heart-shaped brim and brown velvet ribbon around the hat add a lovel accent.
sentences.chinese: 心形边和褐色丝绒带周围的帽子向勒沃尔口音。

sentences.english: I'm gonna wear my blue velet dress for the party.
sentences.chinese: 我要穿我的那件蓝色丝绒洋装参加派对。

sentences.english: The King was enrobed in velvet.
Soft velour thermal fabric nuzzles the skin.
Dark, velvety neutral brown with highlights of light green and lavender.
sentences.chinese: 丝绒般的暗褐色带浅绿和薰衣草紫光芒。

sentences.english: The 2002 Gold Label Coonawarra Cabernet Sauvignon is rich velvet red with purple hues in the glass.
sentences.chinese: 此酒有着红丝绒般的色泽，略泛紫色光泽。

sentences.english: When the loops have been sheared off on one side, the fabric is known as velour.
sentences.chinese: 把一边的小圈圈全部剪掉的面料就叫做丝绒。

sentences.english: A rich wrap of velvet adorns the body.
sentences.chinese: 粉饰丰厚的丝绒包裹身体。

sentences.english: Velvety charcoal with a gentle multi-coloured shimmer.
sentences.chinese: 丝绒般的炭灰色带多种柔和颜色闪。

sentences.english: It comes in red or black velour.
sentences.chinese: 有红色和黑色丝绒两种颜色。

definition: variant of 顯擺|显摆[xian3 bai5]

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
